blog.name: you-are-crazy-beautiful
blog.title: Chyler Leigh called me a smooth talker
blog.description:
Iona, 21, Scotland. In love with too many characters, on too many tv shows. 
Phil Dunphy is my husband.

summary: Perspective on the interviews
body:
Perspective on the interviews

Seriously the fandom needs to relax a bit. We know how Sandra and Jodie are (especially Sandra) in regards to not wanting to put things into a box. Sandra even said that her and Jodie refuse to talk about the relationship between Eve and Villanelle with each other because Eve and Villanelle don’t know exactly how the other feels, so it’s like a form of method acting.

You’ve got to remember as well that the interviews that are coming out just now are for UK viewers who have not seen any of s2. So they’re teasing about what’s to come. In a magazine I bought today at my local store, they talk about the end scene in s1 on the bed and that ‘it was written as much closer between them. Yet they thought 'it was too much, it’s wrong’. 'The audience might want it, but you can’t always give them what they want’. This is them talking about where the relationship was at that time. I agree, when it looked like they were going to kiss in 1x08 I didn’t want it because it didn’t feel right. That Gaytimes article was a mess because we don’t know what they’ve asked Sandra. I think they’ve asked her something specific that if we knew we would probably agree with her answer. For example, in Gaytimes they’ve written Sandra saying the relationship between Villaneve as 'it’s not a focus or message of the show’. Yet in my magazine that I mentioned previously, Sandra says 'the focus is unabashedly about the relationship and psyche of these two female characters’. 'The focus on this show is how much our characters are involved with each other in a deeply psychological way’. They even go on to talk about how some scenes will describe the sexual tension in the script, but that they don’t talk about it because it’s something that is just present between the two.

Sandra even says that Eve is 'a part of her [Villanelle]’.

In s2 a huge part was exploring their feelings for each other. I mean how many times did Eve get off to thoughts of Villanelle? That’s where the writer’s took it. That’s set in stone. No doubt the relationship will keep changing and evolving over seasons. No one knows where it is heading. Not even the writers, so no one has definite answers. So please don’t read into interviews that are designed to tease. Just take in what is shown on the show.

summary: killing eve & qb
title: killing eve & qb
body: okay before i get trampled let be clarify no killing eve isn’t queer bait in the traditional sense - because we know that the characters are at least to some degree sexually attracted to another. the queer bait stems from the people writing it (and apparently sandra oh ?? which i’m hoping was misquoted ??) wanting to pretend that it’s something it is entirely not. it feels almost as if they don’t want to label their sexual attraction to one another bc then the show might be labelled as a ‘gay’ show - and not the thriller sorta show it is. understandably i get this bc the show is more than their relationship but also their relationship, their SEXUAL relationship plays a huge role in their obsession for one another. dismissing it for something that it is not really makes zero sense to me ?? it’s queer bait because they’re trying to capitalise on both straight and gay audiences by keeping it 'ambiguous’ to what their relationship is - contrary to the fact that the literal things occuring in the show all point to it being sexual. at this point it feels verging on ridiculous bc yes there obsession for one another is more than just sexual - the sexual aspect of it is still influencing their decisions. am i naive in thinking eve & v will have a long and beautiful life together ? hell no. but THEY are attracted to one another in both a sexual and romantic sense. the romance from eves view is literally epitomised on the night after she sleeps with hugo and hears v’s voice - ITS ROMANTIC. refusing to label it as something like that feels so illogical

summary: The first genderfluid lead presentation on tv while not being portrayed as a sex object. Beautiful balance in vulnerability &...
body:
The first genderfluid lead presentation on tv while not being portrayed as a sex object. Beautiful balance in vulnerability & self control. Given space to evolve. This is a huge progress for the LGBTQ community setting the source open for future generations!!!!

(Rewatching the seasons and finding so many hidden hints/codes in vill’s appearance and getting emotional all over again. All i wanna say is her intentions towards eve were pure from the beginning and eve is the one dragging her into all of this)

tags: just my thoughts bc wow the backlash i saw on twitter was crazy
summary:
smh @ fans getting sooo riled up about that interview & start outrightly attacking sandra oh,,, smh!
idk it seems to me that any...
body:
smh @ fans getting sooo riled up about that interview & start outrightly attacking sandra oh,,, smh!

idk it seems to me that any close reading of the article will show that sandra is dismissing the idea of a true “romance” between V and Eve and like duh… this show isn’t a romcom lmao

and she straights up say that it’s not “one thing or another” and it’s also about the “discovery of the wider reaches of sexuality” and that seems to me to say that the relationship between V and Eve is a complex one and not a purely romantic one like do they wna fuck or do they wna kill each other? probabaly both… so she’s kinda clearly saying how Eve’s attraction to V is more than a sexual/romantic attraction

i mean it’s a thriller show for god’s sake so to me, it’s absurd to think that the women’s rs can ever be classified to a normal lovey dovey one yknow and i think it’s right for sandra to dismiss that idea - if you wna watch the show purely for the idea of V and Eve having a proper relationship and not bc it’s a proper good show then idk don’t be upset when the show wants to be daring with its storytelling yknow

as much as i would love to see them funk it up and be with each other (as a person who’s lgbt and a woc), idk i could still enjoy the flow and storytelling of s2 even though V and Eve never officially got together

and also, the website kinda has a rep for sensationalised headlines and quoting out of context so idk if it’s any consolation, but take that article with a pinch of salt maybe

(and ok ya the way Sandra was quoted does lowkey has a condescending tone idk so that wasn’t pleasant,,,,, but! i completely get what she was saying and idt she deserves all the nasty flack she’s getting atm but hey that’s just my opinion so feel free to take me with a pinch of salt as well 🤪)

summary:
My take on this Sandra Oh interview:
-This is an interview in ANTICIPATION of season 2. 
-Sandra probably saw the ugly “fandom”...
body:
My take on this Sandra Oh interview:

-This is an interview in ANTICIPATION of season 2.

-Sandra probably saw the ugly “fandom” reaction post-finale and is using this to reset expectations. Namely that this show is NOT a romance. (Eta. Referring to the genre of the show).

-This is sloppy journalism. Sandra said “the best” at some point, but she might have been talking about her dinner last night for all we know.

Conclusion: Chill out. Season 3 is gonna be full of Villaneve. Don’t let a shoddily written interview ruin your mood.
